text: The Ahwar of Southern Iraq: Refuge of Biodiversity and the Relict Landscape of the Mesopotamian Cities is a UNESCO World Heritage Site located in south Iraq. The Ahwar currently consists of seven sites, including three cities of Sumerian origin and four wetland areas of the Mesopotamian Marshes: # Huwaizah Marshes # Central Marshes # East Hammar Marshes # West Hammar Marshes # Uruk Archaeological City # Ur Archaeological City # Tell Eridu Archaeological Site ==References== Category:World Heritage Sites in Iraq
title: Ahwar of Southern Iraq
